intro: Yucca × paradoxa, commonly known as the giant yucca, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Yucca flaccida and Yucca tennesseensis. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, sword-shaped leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in length. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Yucca × paradoxa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
